description: Qualys Web Application Scanning (WAS) is a robust cloud-based application security product that continuously discovers, detects, and catalogs web applications and APIs.
name: qualys-web-application-scanner
label: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS)

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server_url
fields.tooltip: IP address or Hostname of the Qualys Web Application endpoint server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.description: IP address or Hostname of the Qualys Web Application endpoint server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: Username
fields.name: username
fields.tooltip: Provide username credentials with API access to Qualys Web Application.
fields.description: Provide username credentials with API access to Qualys Web Application.

fields.title: Password
fields.name: password
fields.tooltip: Provide password credentials with API access to Qualys Web Application.
fields.description: Provide password credentials with API access to Qualys Web Application.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.

operations.title: Get Scan Count
operations.description: Returns the total number of scans in the user’s account. Input parameters are optional and are used to filter the number of scans included in the count. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission API Access. The count includes scans in the user's scope.

parameters.title: Scan ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the scan ID.
parameters.description: Specify the scan ID.

parameters.title: Scan Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the scan name.
parameters.description: Specify the scan name.

parameters.title: Web App Name
parameters.name: webApp.name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the web application being scanned.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the web application being scanned.

parameters.title: Web App ID
parameters.name: webApp.id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the web application being scanned.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the web application being scanned.

parameters.title: Web App Tag ID
parameters.name: webApp.tags.id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the tag ID assigned to web application being scanned.
parameters.description: Specify the tag ID assigned to web application being scanned.

parameters.title: Reference
parameters.name: reference
parameters.tooltip: Specify the scan reference ID.
parameters.description: Specify the scan reference ID.

parameters.title: Launch Date
parameters.name: launchedDate
parameters.tooltip: Specify the date and time to return all the scan which was launched after specified date and time in UTC date/time format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)
parameters.description: Specify the date and time to return all the scan which was launched after specified date and time in UTC date/time format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)

parameters.title: Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specify the scan type. You can choose from the following options: VULNERABILITY or DISCOVERY.

parameters.title: Mode
parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Specify the mode of the scan. You can choose from the following options: ONDEMAND, SCHEDULED or API.

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Specify the status of the scan. You can choose from the following options: SUBMITTED, RUNNING, FINISHED, TIME_LIMIT_EXCEEDED, SCAN_NOT_LAUNCHED, SCANNER_NOT_AVAILABLE, ERROR or CANCELED.

parameters.title: Authentication Status
parameters.name: authStatus
parameters.description: Specify the status of the authentication record. You can choose from the following options: NONE, NOT_USED, SUCCESSFUL, FAILED or PARTIAL.

parameters.title: Result Status
parameters.name: resultsStatus
parameters.description: Specify the status of the scan. You can choose from the following options: NOT_USED, NO_HOST_ALIVE, NO_WEB_SERVICE, PROCESSING, SCAN_RESULTS_INVALID, TIME_LIMIT_REACHED, SERVICE_ERROR, SCAN_INTERNAL_ERROR, SUCCESSFUL, TO_BE_PROCESSED, TIME_LIMIT_EXCEEDED, SCAN_NOT_LAUNCHED, SCANNER_NOT_AVAILABLE, SUBMITTED, RUNNING, FINISHED, CANCELED, CANCELING ERROR, DELETED.

operations.title: Search Scans
operations.description: Returns a list of scans on web applications which are in the user’s scope. Input parameters are optional and act as filters. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission API Access. The output includes scans in the user's scope.

You can choose from the following options: NOT_USED, NO_HOST_ALIVE, NO_WEB_SERVICE, PROCESSING, SCAN_RESULTS_INVALID, TIME_LIMIT_REACHED, SERVICE_ERROR, SCAN_INTERNAL_ERROR, SUCCESSFUL, TO_BE_PROCESSED, TIME_LIMIT_EXCEEDED, SCAN_NOT_LAUNCHED, SCANNER_NOT_AVAILABLE, SUBMITTED, RUNNING, FINISHED, CANCELED, CANCELING ERROR, DELETED.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: limitResults
parameters.description: Specify the total number of items to return. The default is 100. You can specify a value from 1 to 1,000.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the total number of items to return. The default is 100. You can specify a value from 1 to 1,000.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: startFromOffset
parameters.description: Specify the first item to return by index. The default is 1.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the first item to return by index. The default is 1.

operations.title: Get Scan Details
operations.description: Retrieves details for a scan on a web application which is in the user’s scope. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The output includes authentication records in the user's scope.

parameters.title: Scan ID
parameters.name: scan_id
parameters.description: Specify the scan ID.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the scan ID.

operations.title: Launch Scans
operations.description: Launches web application scanning. You can scan any number of web applications as a Multi-Scan through API. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access” and “Launch WAS Scan“. The output includes scan targets in the user's scope.

parameters.title: Scan Name
parameters.name: scan_name
parameters.description: Specify the scan name.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the scan name.

parameters.title: Scan Type
parameters.name: scan_type
parameters.description: Specify the scan type. You can choose from the following options: VULNERABILITY or DISCOVERY.

parameters.title: Web App ID
parameters.name: web_app_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the web application to include it in the scan
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the web application to include it in the scan

parameters.title: Target Web App Auth Record
parameters.name: web_app_auth_record
parameters.description: Set this to true to use the default web application's authentication record for the scan.
parameters.tooltip: Set this to true to use the default web application's authentication record for the scan.

parameters.title: Target Scanner Appliance Type
parameters.name: scanner_appliance
parameters.description: Specify the type of scanner appliance used for the scan. You can choose from the following options: EXTERNAL or INTERNAL or scannerTags

parameters.title: Scan Profile ID
parameters.name: profile_id
parameters.description: Specify the name of the option profile that includes scan settings. This parameter is required unless the target has a default option profile.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the option profile that includes scan settings. This parameter is required unless the target has a default option profile.

operations.title: Retrieve Scan Status
operations.description: Retrieve the status of a scan on a web application which is in the user’s scope.

parameters.title: Scan ID
parameters.name: scan_id
parameters.description: Specify the scan ID.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the scan ID.

operations.title: Retrieve Scan Results
operations.description: Retrieve the results of a scan on a web application which is in the user’s scope. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The output includes scan targets in the user's scope.

parameters.title: Scan ID
parameters.name: scan_id
parameters.description: Specify the scan ID.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the scan ID.

operations.title: Delete Scan
operations.description: Delete an existing scan on a web application which is in the user’s scope. You can delete any scan in your account that is not running. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access” and ”Delete WAS scan” permission. The scan to be deleted must be within the user’s scope.

parameters.title: Scan ID
parameters.name: scan_id
parameters.description: Specify the scan ID.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the scan ID.

operations.title: Count Web Applications
operations.description: Returns the total number of web applications in the user’s account. Input parameters are optional and are used to filter the number of web applications included in the count. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The count includes web applications in the user's scope.

operations.title: Get Web Application Details
operations.description: Returns details for a web application which is in the user’s scope. The web application screenshot, when available, is included in the output in the “screenshot” element as a base64 encoded binary string. This string needs to be converted before a user can decode and view the image file (.jpg). Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The output includes web applications in the user's scope.

parameters.title: App ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Specify the Web application ID.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Web application ID.

operations.title: Create Web Application
operations.description:
Creates a new web application. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access” and WAS Asset Permission “Create Web Asset”. The output includes web applications in the user's scope. If you want to add postman collection files, you must have the 'ENABLE_POSTMAN_COLLECTION' option enabled for your account. If this option is not enabled, contact Qualys Support to enable this option. When only “name” and “url” are specified:
- Scope defaults to ALL. The scanner will crawl all directories and subdirectories of the starting URL.
- No default option profile is specified. An option profile must be specified for each scan.
- No authentication records are defined. No form or server authentication will be performed.
- No blacklists or whitelists are defined. All directories and sub-directories of the starting URL will be scanned.

parameters.title: Web App Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the web application.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the web application.

parameters.title: Web App URL
parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Specify the URL of the web application.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the URL of the web application.

parameters.title: Web App Auth Record ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Specify the web app auth record ID of the web application.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the web app auth record ID of the web application.

operations.title: Delete Web Applications
operations.description: Delete a web application configuration in your account. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access” and WAS Asset Permission “Delete Web Asset”. The web application to be deleted must be within the user’s scope.

parameters.title: App ID
parameters.name: app_id
parameters.description: Specify the Web application ID.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Web application ID.

operations.title: Search Reports
operations.description: Returns a list of reports which are in the user’s scope. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The output includes reports in the user's scope.

parameters.title: Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specify the report type. You can choose from the following options: WAS_SCAN_REPORT, WAS_WEBAPP_REPORT, WAS_SCORECARD_REPORT, WAS_CATALOG_REPORT or DATALIST_REPORT

parameters.title: Format
parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Specify the format of the report. You can choose from the following options: HTML_ZIPPED, HTML_BASE64, PDF, PDF_ENCRYPTED, POWERPOINT, CSV, CSV_V2, XML or WORD

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Specify the status of the report. You can choose from the following options: RUNNING, ERROR or COMPLETE
